subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Thoughts on My Antique Communication Device? [3 Attachments]
author: Tim Woolworth
full_text:
Kris,

I have no idea what you have there, but it looks great.  Hopefully you can
get it working again.  Try searching out antique radio dealers online or
near your location and show them the photos, maybe you can get a little more
information that way.

Tim

On Mon, Oct 25, 2010 at 3:04 PM, Kris Bronson
<the_rocker_chick1@...>wrote:

>
>  [Attachment(s) <#12be4c7a6b13896d_TopText> from Kris Bronson included
> below]
>
> I'll be the first to admit I'm no expert when it comes to ITC. The majority
> of my experience comes from working with Chris (Moon) and his box for the
> past 3 years. The results still never cease to amaze me!
>
> Anyhow, I came across this device at an estate auction. It appears to be an
> antique communication device of some sort. The only verifiable information I
> have is that is was probably built around 1910-1912, which is before radio
> was publicly available.
> (I obtained this date from researching the packaging cylinder used to build
> the device.)
>
> Does anyone have any thoughts on what it might be? I did show this device
> to Chris a while back and he agreed that it probably was a communication device.
> He also suggested I show it to Frank... = )
> According to Chris's box, "this *IS* a communication device of historical
> value." It also mentioned the device was "meant specifically for me to have,
> but no longer worked." There was more, but I'm trying to remain unbiased and
> only use tangible evidence. However, I have little to go on.
>
> If anyone has any clues or can lead me in a research direction I would
> appreciate it! Thanks!
>
>
>  
>
